metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2977 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel implementation of proxied virtualized TPM devices. On a system where virtualized TPM devices are configured (this is not the default) a local attacker can create a use-after-free and create a situation where it may be possible to escalate privileges on the system.

notes.Note: sbeattie> unclear if fb5abce6b2bb ("tpm: use try_get_ops() in tpm-space.c") is related or a separate issue.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
